name: Administration of Linux Systems
entity: Universidad Carlos III de Madrid, Department of Computer Science
admission_requirements: Basic understanding of computer systems and networking
learning_objectives: Implement security measures to protect Linux systems, including cloud environments
Understand emerging trends in Linux administration, including cloud computing and security best practices

sub_modules.name: Introduction to Linux
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Reading (0.5 hours), Quiz (0.5 hours)

sub_modules.name: Command-Line Interface (CLI)
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Practical Exercise (2 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on exercises to master essential CLI commands

sub_modules.name: File System and Permissions
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Practical Exercise (2 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on exercises to understand file system hierarchy and manage permissions

sub_modules.name: User and Group Management
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Hands-on Lab (3 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on lab to create and manage users and groups

sub_modules.name: Package Management
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Hands-on Lab (3 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on lab to install, update, and remove software packages

sub_modules.name: Networking
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Hands-on Lab (3 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on lab to configure network interfaces and troubleshoot connectivity issues

sub_modules.name: System Monitoring
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Hands-on Lab (3 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on lab to monitor system resources and identify performance bottlenecks

sub_modules.name: Linux Security Fundamentals
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (2 hours), Hands-on Lab (6 hours), Review (2 hours)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on lab configuring firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and security auditing tools

sub_modules.name: Shell Scripting
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1.5 hours), Hands-on Lab (4.5 hours), Project (1.5 hours)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Project-based assignment to automate system administration tasks using shell scripts

sub_modules.name: Python Scripting for Automation
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1.5 hours), Hands-on Lab (4.5 hours), Project (1.5 hours)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Project-based assignment to automate system administration tasks using Python scripts

sub_modules.name: Introduction to Cloud Computing
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Hands-on Lab (3 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on lab to deploy and manage Linux instances on AWS, Azure, or GCP

sub_modules.name: Securing Linux in the Cloud
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Hands-on Lab (3 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on lab to configure security groups, IAM roles, and other cloud security features

sub_modules.name: Automation in the Cloud
sub_modules.time_allocation: Lecture (1 hour), Hands-on Lab (3 hours), Review (1 hour)
sub_modules.learning_activity: Hands-on lab using cloud-specific automation tools

mode_of_instruction: Online lectures and hands-on lab sessions
learning_outcomes: Ability to administer Linux systems effectively
Proficiency in using the command-line interface
Understanding of Linux security principles, including cloud security
Ability to automate tasks using shell scripting
Ability to automate tasks using Python scripting
Ability to deploy and manage Linux systems in cloud environments
learning_activities: Hands-on lab sessions using virtual machines and cloud platforms
Project-based assignments (e.g., setting up a web server, configuring a firewall, automating system updates with shell/python scripts)
trainers: [Trainer Name], PhD in Computer Science, specialization in Systems Administration
[Trainer Name], MSc in Computer Science, expertise in Linux Security
stackability_options: This micro-credential can be stacked towards a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field at Universidad Carlos III de Madrid
quality_assurance: Internal review by the academic committee of the Department of Computer Science at Universidad Carlos III de Madrid
